name: Max
description: Friendly and energetic Golden Retriever who loves to play fetch.
careDiet: Thrives on a balanced diet of high-quality dog food suitable for breed and age. Recommend feeding twice daily with appropriate portion sizes based on weight and activity level. Ensure fresh water is always available.
careExercise: Regular exercise is crucial for physical and mental health. Daily walks, runs, and playtime like fetch are highly recommended for this energetic breed.
careGrooming: Regular brushing (several times a week) helps manage shedding and keeps coat healthy. Occasional baths, regular nail trims, and ear checks are needed.

name: Bella
description: Sweet and gentle Labrador who loves swimming and playing with kids.
careDiet: Needs a balanced diet of high-quality dog food. Monitor portions carefully based on weight and activity level as Labradors can be prone to weight gain. Feed twice daily. Ensure fresh water access.
careExercise: Requires significant regular exercise. Daily walks, swimming (if possible), and active playtime are essential for this breed's well-being.
careGrooming: Short coat requires minimal grooming, but regular brushing helps manage shedding. Check ears regularly, especially after swimming. Needs nail trims.

name: Charlie
description: Curious and playful Beagle with a great sense of smell.
careDiet: Feed high-quality dog food twice daily, controlling portions as Beagles can gain weight easily. Their strong sense of smell might lead them to find extra food!
careExercise: Needs regular daily exercise, including walks on a leash (due to strong scent drive) and playtime in a securely fenced area.
careGrooming: Short coat is easy to maintain with weekly brushing. Pay special attention to ear cleaning as their floppy ears can trap dirt and moisture.

name: Luna
description: Playful Siamese cat with bright blue eyes and a loving personality.
careDiet: Requires a high-quality cat food (wet and/or dry) appropriate for age and activity level. Feed scheduled meals (e.g., twice daily). Ensure constant access to fresh water.
careExercise: Siamese are active and vocal cats. Needs interactive playtime daily using toys like wands or laser pointers (used responsibly). Provide climbing structures like cat trees.
careGrooming: Short coat requires minimal grooming. Most cats groom themselves, but occasional brushing is beneficial, especially during shedding seasons. Monitor nail length.

name: Milo
description: Calm and gentle British Shorthair who loves to cuddle on the couch.
careDiet: Feed high-quality cat food appropriate for their age, controlling portions to maintain a healthy weight. Feed scheduled meals twice daily. Provide fresh water.
careExercise: Less active than some breeds but still enjoys moderate playtime. Engage with interactive toys daily. Provide scratching posts.
careGrooming: Dense coat needs regular brushing (at least weekly) to prevent matting and reduce shedding. Most cats groom themselves well.

name: Nibbles
description: Adorable Guinea Pig who enjoys eating lettuce and squeaking happily.
careDiet: Requires constant access to high-quality Timothy hay, specific guinea pig pellets fortified with Vitamin C, and a daily portion of fresh vegetables (like romaine lettuce, bell peppers). Fresh water is essential.
careExercise: Needs a large, safe enclosure for movement and daily supervised floor time outside the cage in a pet-proofed area for exploration.
careGrooming: Generally clean animals. Long-haired breeds need regular brushing. Monitor teeth for overgrowth and nails for trimming.

name: Whiskers
description: Tiny and energetic hamster who loves running in its wheel.
careDiet: Feed a high-quality hamster food mix daily. Supplement with small amounts of fresh vegetables, fruits, or protein occasionally. Avoid sugary or unsafe foods. Provide fresh water.
careExercise: Requires a spacious cage with deep bedding for burrowing, an appropriately sized exercise wheel (solid surface), and chew toys. Safe, supervised out-of-cage time can be beneficial.
careGrooming: Self-groomers. Provide appropriate bedding material. Sand baths can be offered depending on the species (e.g., Dwarf hamsters).

name: Spike
description: Friendly bearded dragon who enjoys basking under the heat lamp.
careDiet: Omnivorous. Diet consists mainly of live insects (crickets, dubia roaches) gut-loaded and dusted with calcium/vitamins, plus a variety of leafy greens and vegetables offered daily.
careExercise: Needs a large terrarium with proper temperature gradients (basking spot, cool side) and full-spectrum UVB lighting for calcium metabolism. Provide climbing structures.
careGrooming: Minimal grooming. Requires occasional baths to aid shedding and hydration. Keep enclosure clean. Monitor for signs of stuck shed.

name: Zara
description: Colorful gecko who loves to explore and is easy to handle.
careDiet: Insectivorous. Primarily eats live insects like mealworms, crickets, and dubia roaches, properly gut-loaded and dusted with calcium and vitamin supplements.
careExercise: Nocturnal. Requires an appropriately sized terrarium with secure hides (warm, cool, humid), substrate for digging (optional), and a heat mat or lamp for belly heat (no UVB needed).
careGrooming: Minimal grooming. Monitor shedding; a humid hide is crucial to prevent stuck shed, especially on toes. Keep enclosure clean.
